decks.name: Collections
decks.subject: Arraylist, Hashtable, SortedList, Stack, Queue, Dictionary

cards.question: Capacity
cards.answer: Gets or sets the number of elements that the ArrayList can contain.

cards.question: Count
cards.answer: Gets the number of elements actually contained in the ArrayList.

cards.question: IsFixedSize
cards.answer: Gets a value indicating whether the ArrayList has a fixed size.

cards.question: IsReadOnly
cards.answer: Returns whether the ArrayList is read-only

cards.question: Item
cards.answer: Gets or sets the element at the specified index

cards.question: Add(object value)
cards.answer: Adds an object to the end of the ArrayList

cards.question: AddRange(ICollection c)
cards.answer: Adds the elements of an ICollection to the end of the ArrayList.

cards.question: Clear();
cards.answer: Removes all elements of an ArrayList.

cards.question: Contains(object item)
cards.answer: Checks whether an element is in the ArrayList.

cards.question: GetRange(int index, int count);
cards.answer: Returns an ArrayList which represents a subset of the elements in the source ArrayList

cards.question: IndexOf(object);
cards.answer: Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of a value in the ArrayList or in a portion of it

cards.question: Insert(int index, object value);
cards.answer: Inserts an element into the ArrayList at the specified index.

cards.question: InsertRange(int index, ICollection c);
cards.answer: Inserts the elements of a collection into the ArrayList at the specified index.

cards.question: Remove(object obj);
cards.answer: Removes the first occurrence of a specific object from the ArrayList.

cards.question: RemoveAt(int index);
cards.answer: Removes the element at the specified index of the ArrayList.

cards.question: RemoveRange(int index, int count);
cards.answer: Removes a range of elements from the ArrayList

cards.question: Reverse();
cards.answer: Reverses the order of the elements in the ArrayList.

cards.question: SetRange(int index, ICollection c);
cards.answer: Copies the elements of a collection over a range of elements in the ArrayList.

cards.question: Sort()
cards.answer: Sorts the elements in the ArrayList.

cards.question: TrimToSize();
cards.answer: Sets the capacity to the actual number of elements in the ArrayList.

cards.question: Keys
cards.answer: Gets an ICollection containing the keys in the Hashtable

cards.question: Values
cards.answer: Gets an ICollection containing the values in the Hashtable

cards.question: Add(object key, object value);
cards.answer: Adds an element with the specified key and value into the Hashtable

cards.question: ContainsKey(object key);
cards.answer: Determines whether the Hashtable contains a specific key.

cards.question: ContainsValue(object value);
cards.answer: Determines whether the Hashtable contains a specific value.

cards.question: Remove(object key);
cards.answer: Removes the element with the specified key from the Hashtable.

cards.question: GetByIndex(int index);
cards.answer: Gets the value at the specified index of the SortedList.

cards.question: GetKey(int index);
cards.answer: Gets the key at the specified index of the SortedList.

cards.question: GetKeyList();
cards.answer: Returns list of keys in the SortedList

cards.question: GetValueList();
cards.answer: Returns list of values in the SortedList

cards.question: IndexOfKey(object key);
cards.answer: Returns the zero-based index of the specified key in the SortedList.

cards.question: IndexOfValue(object value);
cards.answer: Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified value in the SortedList.

cards.question: Contains(object obj);
cards.answer: Checks if an element is in the Stack.

cards.question: Peek();
cards.answer: Returns the object at the top of the Stack without removing it

cards.question: Pop();
cards.answer: Removes and returns the object at the top of the Stack.

cards.question: Push(object obj);
cards.answer: Inserts an object at the top of the Stack.

cards.question: ToArray();
cards.answer: Copies the Stack to a new array.

cards.question: Dequeue();
cards.answer: Removes and returns the object at the beginning of the Queue.

cards.question: Enqueue(object obj);
cards.answer: Adds an object to the end of the Queue.

cards.question: ContainsKey
cards.answer: Checks if the specified key exists in Dictionary<TKey, TValue>.

cards.question: ContainsValue
cards.answer: Checks if the specified value exists in Dictionary<TKey, TValue>

cards.question: TryGetValue
cards.answer: Returns true and assigns the value with specified key, if key does not exists then return false.

cards.question: public
cards.answer: field or function accessible by any other code in the same assembly or another assembly that references it

cards.question: private
cards.answer: Only available by code in the same class or struct

cards.question: protected
cards.answer: Only accessible by code in the same class or struct or a derived class

cards.question: internal
cards.answer: Accessible by any code in the same assembly, but not from another assembly

cards.question: protected internal
cards.answer: Accessible by any code in the same assembly, or by any derived class in another assembly

cards.question: abstract
cards.answer: to indicate a class that is intended only to be a base class of other classes (has to be extended by other classes)

cards.question: async
cards.answer: Indicates that the modified method, lambda expression, or anonymous method is asynchronous

cards.question: const
cards.answer: Specifies that the value of the field or the local variable cannot be modified (constant)

cards.question: event
cards.answer: Declares an event

cards.question: extern
cards.answer: Indicates that the method is implemented externally

cards.question: new
cards.answer: Explicitly hides a member inherited from a base class

cards.question: override
cards.answer: Provides a new implementation of a virtual member inherited from a base class

cards.question: partial
cards.answer: Defines partial classes, structs, and methods throughout the same assembly

cards.question: read-only
cards.answer: Declares a field that can only be assigned values as part of the declaration or in a constructor in the same class

cards.question: sealed
cards.answer: Specifies that a class cannot be inherited

cards.question: static
cards.answer: Declares a member that belongs to the type itself instead of to a specific object, e.g., for static class or method, no object needs to be created

cards.question: unsafe
cards.answer: Declares an unsafe context

cards.question: virtual
cards.answer: Declares a method or an accessor whose implementation can be changed by an overriding member in a derived class

cards.question: volatile
cards.answer: Indicates that a field can be modified in the program by something such as the operating system, the hardware, or a concurrently executing thread

cards.question: Chars
cards.answer: Gets the Char object at a specified position in the current String object.

cards.question: Length
cards.answer: Gets the number of characters in the current String object.

cards.question: public static int Compare(string strA, string strB)
cards.answer: Compares two specified string objects and returns an integer that indicates their relative position in the sort order.

cards.question: public static int Compare(string strA, string strB, bool ignoreCase )
cards.answer: Compares two specified string objects and returns an integer that indicates their relative position in the sort order. However, it ignores case if the Boolean parameter is true.

cards.question: public static string Concat(string str0, string str1)
cards.answer: Concatenates two string objects.

cards.question: public static string Concat(string str0, string str1, string str2)
cards.answer: Concatenates three string objects.

cards.question: public static string Concat(string str0, string str1, string str2, string str3)
cards.answer: Concatenates four string objects.

cards.question: public bool Contains(string value)
cards.answer: Returns a value indicating whether the specified String object occurs within this string.

cards.question: public static string Copy(string str)
cards.answer: Creates a new String object with the same value as the specified string.

cards.question: public void CopyTo(int sourceIndex, char[] destination, int destinationIndex, int count)
cards.answer: Copies a specified number of characters from a specified position of the String object to a specified position in an array of Unicode characters.

cards.question: public bool EndsWith(string value)
cards.answer: Determines whether the end of the string object matches the specified string.

cards.question: public bool Equals(string value)
cards.answer: Determines whether the current String object and the specified String object have the same value.

cards.question: public static bool Equals(string a, string b)
cards.answer: Determines whether two specified String objects have the same value.

cards.question: public static string Format(string format, Object arg0)
cards.answer: Replaces one or more format items in a specified string with the string representation of a specified object.

cards.question: public int IndexOf(char value)
cards.answer: Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified Unicode character in the current string.

cards.question: public int IndexOf(string value)
cards.answer: Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified string in this instance.

cards.question: public int IndexOf(char value, int startIndex)
cards.answer: Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified Unicode character in this string, starting search at the specified character position.

cards.question: public int IndexOf(string value, int startIndex)
cards.answer: Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified string in this instance, starting search at the specified character position.

cards.question: public int IndexOfAny(char[] anyOf)
cards.answer: Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence in this instance of any character in a specified array of Unicode characters.

cards.question: public int IndexOfAny(char[] anyOf, int startIndex)
cards.answer: Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence in this instance of any character in a specified array of Unicode characters, starting search at the specified character position.

cards.question: public string Insert(int startIndex, string value)
cards.answer: Returns a new string in which a specified string is inserted at a specified index position in the current string object.

cards.question: public static bool IsNullOrEmpty(string value)
cards.answer: Indicates whether the specified string is null or an Empty string.

cards.question: public static string Join(string separator, params string[] value)
cards.answer: Concatenates all the elements of a string array, using the specified separator between each element.

cards.question: public static string Join(string separator, string[] value, int startIndex, int count)
cards.answer: Concatenates the specified elements of a string array, using the specified separator between each element.

cards.question: public int LastIndexOf(char value)
cards.answer: Returns the zero-based index position of the last occurrence of the specified Unicode character within the current string object.

cards.question: public int LastIndexOf(string value)
cards.answer: Returns the zero-based index position of the last occurrence of a specified string within the current string object.

cards.question: public string Remove(int startIndex)
cards.answer: Removes all the characters in the current instance, beginning at a specified position and continuing through the last position, and returns the string.

cards.question: public string Remove(int startIndex, int count)
cards.answer: Removes the specified number of characters in the current string beginning at a specified position and returns the string.

cards.question: public string Replace(char oldChar, char newChar)
cards.answer: Replaces all occurrences of a specified Unicode character in the current string object with the specified Unicode character and returns the new string.

cards.question: public string Replace(string oldValue, string newValue)
cards.answer: Replaces all occurrences of a specified string in the current string object with the specified string and returns the new string.

cards.question: public string[] Split(params char[] separator)
cards.answer: Returns a string array that contains the substrings in the current string object, delimited by elements of a specified Unicode character array.

cards.question: public string[] Split(char[] separator, int count)
cards.answer: Returns a string array that contains the substrings in the current string object, delimited by elements of a specified Unicode character array. The int parameter specifies the maximum number of substrings to return.

cards.question: public bool StartsWith(string value)
cards.answer: Determines whether the beginning of this string instance matches the specified string.

cards.question: public char[] ToCharArray()
cards.answer: Returns a Unicode character array with all the characters in the current string object.

cards.question: public char[] ToCharArray(int startIndex, int length)
cards.answer: Returns a Unicode character array with all the characters in the current string object, starting from the specified index and up to the specified length.

cards.question: public string ToLower()
cards.answer: Returns a copy of this string converted to lowercase.

cards.question: public string ToUpper()
cards.answer: Returns a copy of this string converted to uppercase.

cards.question: public string Trim()
cards.answer: Removes all leading and trailing white-space characters from the current String object.

cards.question: Operator =
cards.answer: Assigns variable value.

cards.question: Operator +
cards.answer: Adds a value or variable.

cards.question: Operator -
cards.answer: Subtracts values or variables.

cards.question: Operator *
cards.answer: Multiplies values or variables.

cards.question: Operator /
cards.answer: Divides values or variables. (i/j)

cards.question: Operator +=
cards.answer: Increments a variable.

cards.question: Operator -=
cards.answer: Decrements a variable.

cards.question: Operator ==
cards.answer: Equality. Returns true if values are equal.

cards.question: Operator !=
cards.answer: Inequality. Returns true if values are not equal.

cards.question: Operator <
cards.answer: Less Than

cards.question: Operator >
cards.answer: Greater Than

cards.question: Operator <=
cards.answer: Less Than or Equal to

cards.question: Operator >=
cards.answer: Greater than equal to

cards.question: Operator + ""
cards.answer: String concatenation

cards.question: Operator .
cards.answer: Call methods, constant variables etc..

cards.question: Operator ()
cards.answer: Calculations, passing parameters etc…

cards.question: Operator []
cards.answer: Access values in arrays or collections.

cards.question: Operator !
cards.answer: Reversing Boolean value

cards.question: Operator &&
cards.answer: Logical AND

cards.question: Operator sizeof()
cards.answer: returns the size of a data type

cards.question: Operator typeof()
cards.answer: returns the type of object – string, integer etc…

cards.question: If Statements
cards.answer: Used to specify a block of code to be executed, if a specified condition is true

cards.question: If - Else Statements
cards.answer: Used to specify a block of code to be executed, if the same condition is false.

cards.question: Switch Statement
cards.answer: evaluates one variable to execute other code for any number of variable values.

cards.question: Case
cards.answer: Evaluates the variable of a switch statement to a specific value and executes code if it evaluates to true.

cards.question: else if statement
cards.answer: Used to specify a new condition to test, if the first condition is false

cards.question: while loop
cards.answer: Continuously loops code until the condition becomes false

cards.question: for loop
cards.answer: loops code for a specific number of iterations.

cards.question: foreach loop
cards.answer: loops code for every instance of a collection

cards.question: break
cards.answer: used to jump out of a loop code block or a switch statement.

cards.question: continue
cards.answer: The statement breaks one iteration (in the loop), if a specified condition occurs, and moves to the next iteration in the loop.

cards.question: Do/While Loop
cards.answer: This loop will execute the code block once, before checking if the condition is true, then it will repeat the loop as long as the condition is true.

cards.question: default
cards.answer: Optional and specifies some code to run if there is no case match in a switch statement
